p: Bisabolol, or more formally α-(−)-bisabolol or also known as levomenol, is a natural monocyclic sesquiterpene alcohol ( Figure 1). It is a primary constituent of the essential oil from Matricaria chamomilla [ 74]. Bisabolol is known to have anti-irritant, anti-inflammatory, and anti-microbial properties. Recently, it was reported that bisabolol demonstrated an antinociceptive-like effect which could be associated with decreased peripheral nerve excitability [ 74]. The decreased nervous excitability elicited by α-(−)-bisabolol might be caused by an irreversible blockade of voltage-dependent Na + channels [ 74].
